result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Apply State and Federal Income Tax Return for 2014 and future years to restitution until paid in full.

timeConds.notes: Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 200 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 03-17-2015. Complete all hours by 10-01-2017 with minimum of 8 hours per month.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling

records.addlTxt: Discharge Certificate.   Effective February 17, 2018, discharged from judgment only.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 200 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 03-17-2015. Complete all hours by 10-01-17 with minimum of 8 hours per month.   Consequences of termination from the program:

Defendant Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge/max. penalties & rights.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court reviews PLQ/WOR.  Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.    State complied with victim rights.  No victim impact statements.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 3 years probation with conditions.  Court waives costs.  Advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court notes waiver of P.H. and binds defendant over for trial.
Defendant Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.
